item.title: Assignments Day 2
item.description: Slides Download slides Assignments Basic linear and nonlinear time series analysis

item.title: Detecting (nonlinear) structure in time series
item.description: Slides Download slides as PDF View slides as HTML Literature Kello, C. T., Brown, G. D., Ferrer-i-Cancho, R., Holden, J. G., Linkenkaer-Hansen, K., Rhodes, T., & Van Orden, G. C. (2010). Scaling laws in cognitive sciences. Trends in cognitive sciences, 14(5), 223-232. Digging deeper The 3blue1down video “Fractals and Scaling” has some great animations of the box-counting domension.

item.title: Fractal physiology, health and well-being
item.description: Guest lecture Maarten Wijnants Slides Download slide Literature Kello, C. T., Brown, G. D., Ferrer-i-Cancho, R., Holden, J. G., Linkenkaer-Hansen, K., Rhodes, T., & Van Orden, G. C. (2010). Scaling laws in cognitive sciences. Trends in cognitive sciences, 14(5), 223-232. Wijnants, M. L. (2014). A review of theoretical perspectives in cognitive science on the presence of scaling in coordinated physiological and cognitive processes. Journal of Nonlinear Dynamics, 962043 (2014), 1-17.

item.title: Quantifying dependencies across multiple scales
item.description: Slides Download slides as PDF View slides as HTML Literature Kello, C. T., Brown, G. D., Ferrer-i-Cancho, R., Holden, J. G., Linkenkaer-Hansen, K., Rhodes, T., & Van Orden, G. C. (2010). Scaling laws in cognitive sciences. Trends in cognitive sciences, 14(5), 223-232. Chapter 6 & 7 of the book Tutorials in Contemporary Nonlinear Methods for Behavioural Science Digging deeper All the fractal videos are pretty cool!
